newsitem.title: FRANCE: French court refuses to free former rail boss.
newsitem.headline: French court refuses to free former rail boss.

text.p: A Paris court rejected on Friday a request by Loik Le Floch-Prigent, former chairman of France's SNCF state railways group, to be freed on bail pending the outcome of a corruption probe, judicial sources said.

Le Floch-Prigent resigned in July after being placed in custody on suspicion of abuse of corporate funds, receiving proceeds of fraud and issuing false information and accounts when he headed French oil giant Elf Aquitaine from 1989 to 1993.

His lawyers asked on Friday that he be released on grounds of poor prison conditions. The court denied the request, saying that an investigating magistrate had recently gathered new evidence against Le Floch-Prigent.
